template.description:
Sets up an http web server that responds to a http request to localhost:33333/trigger with an "ls" of the directory.
Won't work on Windows due to the lack of "ls" command by default.
template.name: HttpExecuteLsCommand

value.description: The maximum number of HTTP requests that can be outstanding at any one time. Any attempt to register an additional HTTP Request will cause an error
value.name: Maximum Outstanding Requests

value.description: Specifies how long an HTTP Request should be left unanswered before being evicted from the cache and being responded to with a Service Unavailable status code
value.name: Request Expiration

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.description: The character set to use for decoding URL parameters if the HTTP Request does not supply one
value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.description: Allow HTTP GET Method
value.name: Allow GET

value.description: Allow HTTP POST Method
value.name: Allow POST

value.description: Allow HTTP PUT Method
value.name: Allow PUT

value.description: Allow HTTP DELETE Method
value.name: Allow DELETE

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method
value.name: Allow HEAD

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.description: A comma-separated list of non-standard HTTP Methods that should be allowed
value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'http.Response.Content-type' HTTP Header
value.name: http.Response.Content-type

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'Content-type' HTTP Header
value.name: Content-type

allowableValues.description: A copy of the FlowFile will be routed to each relationship whose corresponding expression evaluates to 'true'
Requires that all user-defined expressions evaluate to 'true' for the FlowFile to be considered a match
Requires that at least one user-defined expression evaluate to 'true' for hte FlowFile to be considered a match

value.description: Specifies how to determine which relationship to use when evaluating the Expression Language
value.name: Routing Strategy

relationships.description: FlowFiles that do not match any user-define expression will be routed here
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file) in order to apply the regular expressions. Files larger than the specified maximum will not be fully evaluated.
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of characters a given capture group value can have. Any characters beyond the max will be truncated.
value.name: Maximum Capture Group Length

value.description: Indicates that two characters match only when their full canonical decompositions match.
value.name: Enable Canonical Equivalence

value.description: Indicates that two characters match even if they are in a different case. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?i).
value.name: Enable Case-insensitive Matching

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: In this mode, whitespace is ignored, and embedded comments starting with # are ignored until the end of a line. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?x).
value.displayName: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
value.name: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern

value.description: Indicates that the expression '.' should match any character, including a line terminator. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?s).
value.name: Enable DOTALL Mode

entry.key: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that Metacharacters and escape characters should be given no special meaning.
value.displayName: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern
value.name: Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

value.description: Indicates that '^' and '$' should match just after and just before a line terminator or end of sequence, instead of only the begining or end of the entire input. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?m).
value.name: Enable Multiline Mode

value.description: When used with 'Enable Case-insensitive Matching', matches in a manner consistent with the Unicode Standard. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?u).
value.name: Enable Unicode-aware Case Folding

value.description: Specifies conformance with the Unicode Technical Standard #18: Unicode Regular Expression Annex C: Compatibility Properties. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?U).
value.name: Enable Unicode Predefined Character Classes

value.description: Indicates that only the ' ' line terminator is recognized in the behavior of '.', '^', and '$'. Can also be specified via the embeded flag (?d).
value.name: Enable Unix Lines Mode

value.description: Indicates that Capture Group 0 should be included as an attribute. Capture Group 0 represents the entirety of the regular expression match, is typically not used, and could have considerable length.
value.name: Include Capture Group 0

entry.key: Permit Whitespace and Comments in Pattern
Enable Literal Parsing of the Pattern

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when the Regular Expression is successfully evaluated and the FlowFile is modified as a result
relationships.name: matched

relationships.description: FlowFiles are routed to this relationship when no provided Regular Expression matches the content of the FlowFile
relationships.name: unmatched

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value.
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the regular expressions. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored and the buffer is not used if 'Regular Expression' is set to '.*'
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: The value to insert using the 'Replacement Strategy'. Using "Regex Replace" back-references to Regular Expression capturing groups are supported, but back-references that reference capturing groups that do not exist in the regular expression will be treated as literal value.
value.name: Replacement Value

value.description: The Character Set in which the file is encoded
value.name: Character Set

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the regular expressions. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored and the buffer is not used if 'Regular Expression' is set to '.*'
value.name: Maximum Buffer Size

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

value.description: The strategy for how and what to replace within the FlowFile's text content.
value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.
value.name: Evaluation Mode

relationships.description: FlowFiles that could not be updated are routed to this relationship
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles that have been successfully processed are routed to this relationship. This includes both FlowFiles that had text replaced and those that did not.
relationships.name: success

value.description: The HTTP Status Code to use when responding to the HTTP Request. See Section 10 of RFC 2616 for more information.
value.name: HTTP Status Code

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: Specifies the value to send for the 'http.Response.Content-type' HTTP Header
value.name: http.Response.Content-type

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this Relationship if the Processor is unable to respond to the requestor. This may happen, for instance, if the connection times out or if NiFi is restarted before responding to the HTTP Request.
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: FlowFiles will be routed to this Relationship after the response has been successfully sent to the requestor
relationships.name: success

allowableValues.description: Generates 'bins' of FlowFiles and fills each bin as full as possible. FlowFiles are placed into a bin based on their size and optionally their attributes (if the <Correlation Attribute> property is set)

Combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. If using this strategy, all FlowFiles must have the attributes <fragment.identifier>, <fragment.count>, and <fragment.index> or alternatively (for backward compatibility purposes) <segment.identifier>, <segment.count>, and <segment.index>. All FlowFiles with the same value for "fragment.identifier" will be grouped together. All FlowFiles in this group must have the same value for the "fragment.count" attribute. All FlowFiles in this group must have a unique value for the "fragment.index" attribute between 0 and the value of the "fragment.count" attribute.

value.description: Specifies the algorithm used to merge content. The 'Defragment' algorithm combines fragments that are associated by attributes back into a single cohesive FlowFile. The 'Bin-Packing Algorithm' generates a FlowFile populated by arbitrarily chosen FlowFiles
value.name: Merge Strategy

allowableValues.description: A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single TAR file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the TAR file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the TAR file. If a FlowFile has an attribute named <tar.permissions> that is 3 characters, each between 0-7, that attribute will be used as the TAR entry's 'mode'.

A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single ZIP file. The FlowFiles' <path> attribute will be used to create a directory in the ZIP file if the <Keep Paths> property is set to true; otherwise, all FlowFiles will be added at the root of the ZIP file. The <Compression Level> property indicates the ZIP compression to use.
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 3 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 2 FlowFile Stream
A bin of FlowFiles will be combined into a single Version 1 FlowFile Package
The contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile
The Avro contents of all FlowFiles will be concatenated together into a single FlowFile

value.description: Determines the format that will be used to merge the content.
value.name: Merge Format

value.description: Determines which FlowFile attributes should be added to the bundle. If 'Keep All Unique Attributes' is selected, any attribute on any FlowFile that gets bundled will be kept unless its value conflicts with the value from another FlowFile. If 'Keep Only Common Attributes' is selected, only the attributes that exist on all FlowFiles in the bundle, with the same value, will be preserved.
value.name: Attribute Strategy

value.description: If specified, like FlowFiles will be binned together, where 'like FlowFiles' means FlowFiles that have the same value for this Attribute. If not specified, FlowFiles are bundled by the order in which they are pulled from the queue.
value.name: Correlation Attribute Name

value.description: The minimum number of files to include in a bundle
value.name: Minimum Number of Entries

value.description: The maximum number of files to include in a bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Number of Entries

value.description: The minimum size of for the bundle
value.name: Minimum Group Size

value.description: The maximum size for the bundle. If not specified, there is no maximum.
value.name: Maximum Group Size

value.description: The maximum age of a Bin that will trigger a Bin to be complete. Expected format is <duration> <time unit> where <duration> is a positive integer and time unit is one of seconds, minutes, hours
value.name: Max Bin Age

value.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins that can be held in memory at any one time
value.name: Maximum number of Bins

allowableValues.description: The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be retrieved from the contents of a file
The values of Header, Footer, and Demarcator will be specified as property values

value.description: Determines if Header, Footer, and Demarcator should point to files containing the respective content, or if the values of the properties should be used as the content.
value.name: Delimiter Strategy

value.description: Filename specifying the header to use. If not specified, no header is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Header File

value.description: Filename specifying the footer to use. If not specified, no footer is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Footer File

value.description: Filename specifying the demarcator to use. If not specified, no demarcator is supplied. This property is valid only when using the binary-concatenation merge strategy; otherwise, it is ignored.
value.name: Demarcator File

value.description: Specifies the compression level to use when using the Zip Merge Format; if not using the Zip Merge Format, this value is ignored
value.name: Compression Level

value.description: If using the Zip or Tar Merge Format, specifies whether or not the FlowFiles' paths should be included in their entry names; if using other merge strategy, this value is ignored
value.name: Keep Path

relationships.description: If the bundle cannot be created, all FlowFiles that would have been used to created the bundle will be transferred to failure
relationships.name: failure

relationships.description: The FlowFile containing the merged content
relationships.name: merged

relationships.description: The FlowFiles that were used to create the bundle
relationships.name: original

value.description: The arguments to supply to the executable delimited by the ';' character.
value.name: Command Arguments

value.description: Specifies the command to be executed; if just the name of an executable is provided, it must be in the user's environment PATH.
value.name: Command Path

value.description: If true, the contents of the incoming flowfile will not be passed to the executing command
value.name: Ignore STDIN

value.description: The directory to use as the current working directory when executing the command
value.name: Working Directory

value.description: Delimiter to use to separate arguments for a command [default: ;]. Must be a single character
value.name: Argument Delimiter

value.description: If set, the output of the stream command will be put into an attribute of the original FlowFile instead of a separate FlowFile. There will no longer be a relationship for 'output stream'. The value of this property will be the key for the output attribute.
value.name: Output Destination Attribute

value.description: If routing the output of the stream command to an attribute, the number of characters put to the attribute value will be at most this amount. This is important because attributes are held in memory and large attributes will quickly cause out of memory issues. If the output goes longer than this value, it will truncated to fit. Consider making this smaller if able.
value.name: Max Attribute Length

relationships.description: The destination path for the flow file created from the command's output
relationships.name: output stream

value.description: The Port to listen on for incoming HTTP requests
value.name: Listening Port

value.description: The Hostname to bind to. If not specified, will bind to all hosts
value.name: Hostname

value.description: The SSL Context Service to use in order to secure the server. If specified, the server will accept only HTTPS requests; otherwise, the server will accept only HTTP requests
value.name: SSL Context Service

value.description: The HTTP Context Map Controller Service to use for caching the HTTP Request Information
value.name: HTTP Context Map

value.description: A Regular Expression that specifies the valid HTTP Paths that are allowed in the incoming URL Requests. If this value is specified and the path of the HTTP Requests does not match this Regular Expression, the Processor will respond with a 404: NotFound
value.name: Allowed Paths

value.description: The character set to use for decoding URL parameters if the HTTP Request does not supply one
value.name: Default URL Character Set

value.description: Allow HTTP GET Method
value.name: Allow GET

value.description: Allow HTTP POST Method
value.name: Allow POST

value.description: Allow HTTP PUT Method
value.name: Allow PUT

value.description: Allow HTTP DELETE Method
value.name: Allow DELETE

value.description: Allow HTTP HEAD Method
value.name: Allow HEAD

value.description: Allow HTTP OPTIONS Method
value.name: Allow OPTIONS

value.description: A comma-separated list of non-standard HTTP Methods that should be allowed
value.name: Additional HTTP Methods

allowableValues.description: Processor will not authenticate clients. Anyone can communicate with this Processor anonymously
Processor will try to verify the client but if unable to verify will allow the client to communicate anonymously
Processor will reject communications from any client unless the client provides a certificate that is trusted by the TrustStorespecified in the SSL Context Service

value.description: Specifies whether or not the Processor should authenticate clients. This value is ignored if the <SSL Context Service> Property is not specified or the SSL Context provided uses only a KeyStore and not a TrustStore.
value.name: Client Authentication

relationships.description: All content that is received is routed to the 'success' relationship
relationships.name: success

value.description: The Search Value to search for in the FlowFile content. Only used for 'Literal Replace' and 'Regex Replace' matching strategies
value.name: Regular Expression

value.description: Specifies the maximum amount of data to buffer (per file or per line, depending on the Evaluation Mode) in order to apply the regular expressions. If 'Entire Text' (in Evaluation Mode) is selected and the FlowFile is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, if a single line is larger than this value, the FlowFile will be routed to 'failure'. A default value of 1 MB is provided, primarily for 'Entire Text' mode. In 'Line-by-Line' Mode, a value such as 8 KB or 16 KB is suggested. This value is ignored and the buffer is not used if 'Regular Expression' is set to '.*'

allowableValues.description: Insert the Replacement Value at the beginning of the FlowFile or the beginning of each line (depending on the Evaluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be prepended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be prepended to the entire text.

Insert the Replacement Value at the end of the FlowFile or the end of each line (depending on the Evluation Mode). For "Line-by-Line" Evaluation Mode, the value will be appended to each line. For "Entire Text" evaluation mode, the value will be appended to the entire text.

Interpret the Search Value as a Regular Expression and replace all matches with the Replacement Value. The Replacement Value may reference Capturing Groups used in the Search Value by using a dollar-sign followed by the Capturing Group number, such as $1 or $2. If the Search Value is set to .* then everything is replaced without even evaluating the Regular Expression.
Search for all instances of the Search Value and replace the matches with the Replacement Value.

value.name: Replacement Strategy

value.description: Run the 'Replacement Strategy' against each line separately (Line-by-Line) or buffer the entire file into memory (Entire Text) and run against that.

entry.value:
403
Now you know that target won't work
